intro: Hieracium lineare, commonly known as the slender hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows to a height of 20–60 cm, with slender, upright stems and basal leaves that are lance-shaped. Its flowers are yellow, arranged in a composite head, and bloom from late spring to early autumn. Hieracium lineare is often found in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed sites, and it can spread vegetatively through its rhizomes.
